item.title: Jessi add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "One day you will do things for me that you hate. That is what it means to be family." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Having a baby is like getting a tattoo on your face. You really need to be certain it's what you want before you commit." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Amy Jenkins
item.description: "How bad does it have to be before you do something about it?" -- Amy Jenkins

item.title: Jessi add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "If you are bored and disgusted by politics and don't bother to vote, you are in effect voting for the entrenched Establishments of the two major parties, who please rest assured are not dumb, and who are keenly aware that it is in their interests to keep you disgusted and bored and cynical and to give you every possible reason to stay at home doing one-hitters and watching MTV on primary day. By all means stay home if you want, but don't bullshit yourself that you're not voting. In reality, there is <i>no such thing as not voting:</i> you either vote by voting, or you vote by staying home and tacitly doubling the value of some Diehard's vote." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Edward R. Murrow
item.description: "A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves." -- Edward R. Murrow

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "Remember, remember always, that all of us, and you and I especially, are descended from immigrants and revolutionists." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You wouldn't worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You can’t live long enough to make them all yourself. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude" -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Erica Bauermeister
item.description: "They said - Adults need to have fun so children will want to grow up." -- Erica Bauermeister

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Erica Bauermeister
item.description: "Breath is life in" -- Erica Bauermeister

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Erica Bauermeister
item.description: "I think love is kind of like those waves out there," she said. "You ride one in to the beach, and it's the most amazing thing you've ever felt. But at some point the water goes back out; it has to. And maybe you're lucky-maybe you're both too busy to do anything drastic. Maybe you're good as friends, so you stay. And then something happens-maybe it's something as big as a baby, or as small as him unloading the dishwasher-and the wave comes back in again. And it does that, over and over. I just think sometimes people forget to wait." -- Erica Bauermeister

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Jessi add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx
